attributes.comment:
Dear Sir/Madam:
My name is Lisa Lenz. My husband, Steve, and I are in the process of adopting a
child from China. We have tried for 10 years to conceive a baby and it has not
happened even though every doctor says we should be fine. This has been a
difficult journey. Therefore, we decided to adopt and we are very excited to adopt
a little girl from China. However, China has extended the wait time beyond the 18
months that our 171H form is valid. We will have to re-file the I-600A form. We
will have to pay an additional $830. When you adopt, it is a very costly endeavor
that will be well worth the money. However, it would help us if the fees for the I-
600A were not increased and we only had to pay an additional $685.

We are also pleading with the Judiciary committee to extend the validity of the
171H from 18 months to 24 months. To re-file is time consuming as well as
expensive. Please consider our plea to not increase the fees for the advanced
processing petition for adoption of an orphan (I-600A form).

Thank you for your consideration in this matter.

Sincerely,
Lisa and Steve Lenz
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Lisa A. Lenz
